title: Mallorca 0-1 Barcelona: Robert Lewandowski scores again as Barca go top of La Liga
description: Robert Lewandowski scores his ninth goal in seven La Liga matches as Barcelona win at Mallorca to go top.

title: Burkina Faso coup: Gunshots in capital and roads blocked
description: The army captain who announced Friday's takeover says the ousted leader is planning a counter-attack.

title: ‘Unbelievable’ & ‘strange’ – is VAR letting Premier League down?
description: BBC Sport looks at the key refereeing decisions on a dramatic and controversial day of Premier League action.

title: King Charles will not attend COP27, says Palace
description: The monarch and prime minister agreed the King would not attend after he sought government advice.

title: West Ham United 2-0 Wolverhampton Wanderers: Scamacca's first Premier League goal helps hosts claim valuable win
description: Gianluca Scamacca's first Premier League goal sends West Ham on their way to a comfortable victory over fellow early-season strugglers Wolves.

title: Liverpool 3-3 Brighton: Jurgen Klopp vows Reds will fight through difficult spell
description: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp vows his side will fight through their poor form as Reds' draw with Brighton leaves them 11 points off the top of the table.

title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Man charged with schoolgirl's murder
description: A 34-year-old man is charged over the death of the nine-year-old who was shot in her Liverpool home.

title: Arsenal 3-1 Tottenham: Gunners show identity & direction in outstanding derby win
description: Arsenal have flattered to deceive in recent seasons but their outstanding win against Tottenham is proof they have rediscovered their identity.

title: Liverpool 3-3 Brighton: Leandro Trossard scores hat-trick to deny Reds victory
description: Leandro Trossard scores a hat-trick as Brighton mark new coach Roberto de Zerbi's debut with a hugely entertaining draw against Liverpool at Anfield.

title: Crystal Palace 1-2 Chelsea: Conor Gallagher hits late winner to earn boss Graham Potter first victory
description: Conor Gallagher returns to Selhurst Park to haunt Crystal Palace with a stunning late winner to give Graham Potter a controversial first win as Chelsea boss.

title: Redcar steel plant: 'Biggest demolition' of its kind in 75 years
description: Up to 1.6 tonnes of explosives were used to level the 65m (213ft) structure.

title: Ukraine war: Russian troops forced out of eastern town Lyman
description: The retreat came amid fears thousands of soldiers would be encircled in Lyman, and is seen as a significant blow.

title: Protests held over climate crisis and energy rises
description: The day of action across the UK sees people highlight the cost-of-living crisis and the environment.

title: Premiership: Saracens 51-18 Leicester Tigers - Sarries dominate defending champions
description: Saracens make it three straight victories to start the Premiership season by crushing defending champions Leicester.

title: Celtic 2-1 Motherwell: Reo Hatate's fantastic strike gives champions win
description: Reo Hatate's fantastic strike ensured Celtic bounced back from their first Scottish Premiership defeat in a year with victory against Motherwell.

title: Climb down or stand firm - what does Truss do next?
description: Laura Kuenssberg on what options the PM - one of her guests on Sunday - has to calm her party.

title: Palestinian deaths toll in West Bank hits 100 this year
description: The deadliest tally in years comes amid a big increase in Israeli military raids.

title: Moors Murders: No remains yet found in search for Keith Bennett
description: Greater Manchester Police says it will continue excavation works but "conditions are difficult".

title: Mark Mardell reveals he has Parkinson's disease
description: The former BBC presenter jokes he is "getting used to being the quietest person in the room".

title: Singapore Grand Prix: Charles Leclerc on pole after Max Verstappen fuel issue
description: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc takes pole position after a gripping qualifying at the Singapore Grand Prix as Max Verstappen finishes only eighth.

title: Lev Tahor: Jewish sect leaders arrested in Mexico jungle raid freed
description: The release is the latest twist in events surrounding the group after a dramatic breakout in Mexico.

title: Arsenal 3-1 Tottenham: Gunners beat 10-man rivals to extend lead at top of Premier League
description: Thomas Partey, Gabriel Jesus and Granit Xhaka score as Arsenal overcome 10-man Tottenham to go four points clear at the top of the Premier League.

title: Remains of WW2 pilot buried 78 years after fatal flight
description: Flight Sergeant William Robert Stephen Hurrell's remains were discovered in the Netherlands in 2019.

title: Heart of Midlothian 0-4 Rangers: Visitors go top with Tynecastle rout
description: Ruthless Rangers move top of the Scottish Premiership after an impressive thrashing of 10-man Hearts.

title: Formula 1 budget cap row: Mercedes and Ferrari comments 'unacceptable' - Red Bull
description: Red Bull team principal Christian Horner says he is "absolutely confident" his team did not breach Formula 1's budget cap in 2021.

title: Ukraine war: Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant chief detained by Russians - Kyiv
description: The boss of Europe's biggest nuclear plant was blindfolded and led away by Russian troops, Ukraine says.

title: Redcar steelworks demolition biggest of its kind in 75 years
description: The Basic Oxygen Steelmaking (BOS) Plant was brought down using 1.6 tonnes of explosives.

title: Tesla boss Elon Musk presents humanoid robot Optimus
description: The tech billionaire claims the robot will change the future of physical work.

title: Storm Ian: Protests as Cuba capital Havana remains in darkness
description: Cuba's capital lost power when Hurricane Ian hit days ago, and parts still remain in the dark.

title: That isn't me, Kwarteng tells Mirror over wrong image
description: The Mirror newspaper apologises after mistaking another man for the chancellor in an online story.

title: Former Iran detainee 'determined' to finish Marathon
description: Anoosheh Ashoori, 68, says he is taking part to raise awareness about others held captive.

title: London Marathon 2022: Everything you need to know - who is taking part and what time does it start?
description: The London Marathon is almost upon us. Here is everything you need to know as 42,000 runners prepare to tackle the iconic course.

title: Paraplegic scuba diver attempts three Guinness World Records
description: Dan Metcalfe was left with no muscle use from his chest downwards after a motorbike accident.

title: NFL International Series 2022: All you need to know before London games
description: The NFL returns to London this month with three games over five weekends, with the Green Bay Packers becoming the final NFL team to play in the UK.

title: Arsenal: Are Mikel Arteta's side really a lot better this season?
description: As Premier League leaders Arsenal prepare to face Tottenham in the north London derby, but are they really a lot better this season?

title: Bellator 286: Adam Borics on his journey from a tiny village in Hungary to world-title bid
description: BBC Sport speaks to Adam Borics about his journey to becoming a Bellator title contender, including a quickfire wedding and making ends meet by cleaning the gym he trained in.

title: World Cup: The past 50 goals scored by England players (plus one own goal)
description: With 50 days to go until the start of the World Cup in Qatar, BBC Sport looks back at the past 50 goals scored by England players in the competition (as well as one own goal).

title: Ukraine war: Biden says US will not be intimidated by reckless Putin
description: The US president leads condemnation of Vladimir Putin after he annexes four occupied regions of Ukraine.

title: Hurricane Ian: Bigotry couldn't beat this family - then came the storm
description: Their ancestors were among the first black Americans on Sanibel Island. Hurricane Ian drove them away.

title: London Marathon 2022: Running for charity 'a chance to give back'
description: Two marathon runners tell BBC Newsbeat about overcoming the odds to compete in the London Marathon.
